properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 3:51AM PST until March 2 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHERN
CALIFORNIA...

.A cold storm system will move across Southern California today
and tonight. The snow levels will drop rapidly this evening and
the combination of snow, gusty winds, fog and slick roads will
impact the mountain roads. Freezing conditions will develop in the
mountain passes as well.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. Tree
branches could fall as well. Total snow accumulations of up to
two inches, with localized amounts up to 5 inches.

* WHERE...Mainly elevations at or above 4500 feet.

* WHEN...4 PM today to 10 AM Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at
times.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

For road condition information in California...enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST MONDAY
